TopicTitle: Build singular sentence without using the first letter of the English lexicon.

Articles.Content:
It's worrying when the wide world wizzes, wretchedly wrenching the outlook of optimistic onlookers.

(Oh look, newly sequenced documentation on which to write prose)

Edited February 4 by ColdJ
This is my "no first letter" sentence, so this is it, god bless you.
Oh oh sometimes, I get the good feeling, I get the feeling I've never never never felt before, I get the good feeling, yeh.
Do my fellow forum-goers notice how the title of this discussion didn't even succeed in its own enterprise?
i think this sentence doesn't possess the letter in the beginning of the English writing lexicon system.

Specify specifics so you know the specified specifics intently to not mess up in the process of specified jobs of being specific in specified specifics.

I wonder if the world will ever return to times of less strife?
This isn't extremely difficult, even I did it without much thought for it.

[Intro]
Shhhh, shhhh

[Verse 1]
It's oh, so quiet
Shhhh, shhhh
It's oh, so still
Shhhh, shhhh
You is remote
Shhhh, shhhh
And so quiet until

[Chorus 1]
You plunge in love
Zing, boom
The sky up there
Zing, boom
Is stoving in
Wow, boom

[Bridge 1]
You've never been so nuts for this guy
You try to smile, you're going to cry
You cross your chest then hope to die

[Verse 2]
Till it's over, and then
Shhhh, shhhh
It's nice and quiet
Shhhh, shhhh
But soon once more
Shhhh, shhhh
Sets off the big riot
